merged_content:
User and Account Management API Guide

This guide provides comprehensive information on managing user accounts programmatically across systems using REST API. It covers authentication, authorization, and available endpoints for user and account management tasks.

Authentication and Authorization

All API requests require authentication to ensure secure operations. Use the following methods:

  • Authentication: API keys or tokens are required for all requests.
  • Authorization: Use Bearer YOUR_API_KEY or Token YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN for authorization.

Core Endpoints

The API supports the following endpoints for managing user accounts:

Retrieve User Accounts

  • GET /api/users: Retrieve a list of all users in the system.
  • GET /api/accounts: Fetch a list of user accounts from the system.

Create User Accounts

  • POST /api/users: Create a new user account with specified permissions.
  • POST /api/accounts: Register a new user account with required details.

Update User Accounts

  • PUT /api/users/{id}: Update an existing user account and its properties.
  • PATCH /api/accounts/{id}: Modify existing account details and permissions.

Delete User Accounts

  • DELETE /api/users/{id}: Delete a user account from the system permanently.
  • DELETE /api/accounts/{id}: Remove a user account from the system database.

This API provides comprehensive user and account management capabilities for both administrative tasks and personal applications.
